meanings.definition: A large, shapeless mass or spot of something.
meanings.sent1: The artist accidentally dropped a big splodge of paint on the canvas.
meanings.sent2: I stepped in a splodge of mud on the path.
meanings.sent3: The cat left a splodge of fur on the couch after napping there.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered into a dark splodge over the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The toddler's finger painting was a colorful splodge of creativity.

meanings.definition: To mark or cover with splodges.
meanings.sent1: She splodged paint all over the paper during art class.
meanings.sent2: The kids splodged glitter on the homemade card for their mom.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally splodged ketchup on his shirt while eating a hotdog.
meanings.sent4: The artist splodged vibrant colors onto the canvas, creating a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The chef splodged sauce on the plate to add a decorative touch to the dish.

meanings.definition: A blot or smear of something.
meanings.sent1: There was a splodge of ink on the paper from the leaky pen.
meanings.sent2: She noticed a splodge of sauce on her shirt after dinner.
meanings.sent3: The detective found a suspicious splodge of blood at the crime scene.
meanings.sent4: The map had a splodge of coffee on the corner from the morning rush.
meanings.sent5: The mirror had a splodge of toothpaste from the morning routine.
